item.title: Random Pickings
item.description: Predestination in scripture is a mystery to some and misinterpreted by others. However, if we search scripture we can understand what predestination means in the Word. It is not random picking of this person and not another. The mechanism God uses is the same He used with Pharaoh in Exodus that hardened Pharaoh's heart. Pharaoh's heart was hardened by the miracles Moses performed. Not by God changing him. In that same way scripture is crafted to attract the person of faith and at the same time to be rejected by the so called wise of this world. Romans 9:6ff

item.title: ENCOUNTERS OF THE FOURTH TIME
item.description: As the world marks the Resurrection of Jesus, let us focus on the account of Paul, who also saw the resurrected Savior. In 1 Cor. 15 Paul tells of the appearances of Jesus. The fourth account is of Saul's encounter of Jesus and becoming Paul. What if Paul had still rejected Jesus?

item.title: Who?
item.description: Who is this mysterious Melchizedek? King and priest with no beginning and no ending. Christ was not of the tribe of Levi so under the Law He could not be a priest. Israel recognized that there was another who came before and was both king and priest. Jesus was of that line. Heb. 6 and 7.
